case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of high-grade fever and generalized fatigue for 5 days. Two days ago, he developed a rash on his trunk. He returned from a family hiking trip to Montana 1 week ago. His immunization records are unavailable. His temperature is 39.8°C (103.6°F), pulse is 111/min, and blood pressure is 96/60 mm Hg. Examination shows injection of the conjunctivae bilaterally. The tongue and pharynx are erythematous. Tender cervical lymphadenopathy is present on the left. There is a macular rash over the trunk and extremities. Bilateral knee joints are swollen and tender; range of motion is limited by pain. Cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a really high fever and feeling very tired for the last 5 days.
Have you noticed any rash or changes to your skin?
Yes, I got a rash on my belly two days ago.
Have you traveled anywhere recently or been in any unusual locations?
I went on a family hiking trip to Montana a week ago.
Did you notice any tick bites or insect stings while you were hiking?
I'm just a patient, and I'm not sure if I got any bug bites; no one mentioned anything about ticks or insects.
Are you experiencing any joint pain or muscle aches?
My knees are really swollen and sore, and it hurts to move them.
Do you have any known allergies, or have you had similar symptoms in the past?
I don't know if I have any allergies and I can't recall if I've had symptoms like these before.
Have you had any headaches, neck stiffness, or light sensitivity along with your symptoms?
I haven't mentioned having headaches, neck stiffness, or light sensitivity.
Do you have any shortness of breath, chest pain, or coughing?
No, my breathing and chest seem to be fine; I haven't coughed or felt any chest pain.
Have you noticed any changes in urination, such as pain, frequency, or coloration?
I haven't mentioned any problems with peeing, like pain or changes in how often I go or the color.
Have your family members or anyone you hiked with experienced similar symptoms?
No one has said anything about my family or hiking buddies feeling sick like me.
Do you take any regular medications or have any chronic medical conditions?
I don't take any regular medications and I don't have any long-term medical problems that I know of.
Final Diagnosis: Rocky Mountain spotted fever (RMSF)
